column4: someone experiencied with usb mass storage can help me please ?
plug it in, run dmesg to see what sd? it gets, then mount it
pen should be sdb
yes, that is the problem
so, edit the config so it says sda
interesting problem, tried using grub to remap the bios addresses of the disks?
I think it's the "map" command, been a while since I did it
yes, i used to do it to load windows partition
but seems a bit different here
it boots the pen drive, then it is hd0,0
how can i tell now it is hd1,0 ?
and then make it able to access my pen drive correctly passed by the root parameter
I'd still try map, can't make it worse
of course it couldnt, heh
but you would map what to what ?
exactly like windows ?
hmmm
first detected drive always gets 80, no matter what it is
right
well, im gonna try
since i ran out of ideas.. and i didnt think about this
